transportAdvice: Tallinn's compact Old Town is highly walkable, making it easy to explore major attractions on foot. The city also has a reliable network of buses, trams, and trolleybuses covering wider areas, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cold, dark winter month with frequent snow and frost; pack warm layers and waterproof boots.
The coldest month of the year with persistent snow and icy conditions; heavy winter clothing is essential.
Late winter with slowly rising temperatures; snow begins to melt but cold spells remain common.
Spring arrives with milder days and longer daylight hours, though cool temperatures and rain are still likely.
Pleasant spring weather with blooming greenery and comfortable temperatures; a popular time to visit.
Early summer with long daylight hours approaching the white nights; warm and generally enjoyable conditions.
The warmest month of the year with long days and lively outdoor atmosphere; occasional rain showers possible.
Warm late summer conditions with slightly shorter days; comfortable for sightseeing and outdoor activities.
Autumn sets in with cooler temperatures and more frequent rain; foliage begins to turn in parks and forests.
Cool and often wet with grey skies; a light jacket and waterproof layer are recommended.
Cold and damp with the first frosts and occasional snow; daylight hours are noticeably short.
Cold winter month with snow likely and festive Christmas markets adding charm to the Old Town.
